<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Update status message"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"put"}
  path={"/v2/actor-runs/{runId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



<span class="openapi-clients-box"></span><span id="/reference/actor-runs/update-status-message/update-status-message"></span><span id="/reference/actor-runs/update-status-message"></span>You can set a single status message on your run that will be displayed in
the Apify Console UI. During an actor run, you will typically do this in order
to inform users of your actor about the actor's progress.

The request body must contain `runId` and `statusMessage` properties. The
`isStatusMessageTerminal` property is optional and it indicates if the
status message is the very last one. In the absence of a status message, the
platform will try to substitute sensible defaults.


<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"runId","in":"path","description":"Run ID.","required":true,"style":"simple","schema":{"type":"string","example":"3KH8gEpp4d8uQSe8T"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"description":"","content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"allOf":[{"title":"UpdateRunRequest","required":["runId","statusMessage"],"type":"object","properties":{"runId":{"type":"string","example":"3KH8gEpp4d8uQSe8T"},"statusMessage":{"type":"string","example":"Actor has finished"},"isStatusMessageTerminal":{"type":"boolean","example":true}}},{"example":{"runId":"3KH8gEpp4d8uQSe8T","statusMessage":"Actor has finished","isStatusMessageTerminal":true}}]},"example":{"runId":"3KH8gEpp4d8uQSe8T","statusMessage":"Actor has finished","isStatusMessageTerminal":true}}},"required":true}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
